turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I knew this would happen!  You're like a lost puppy!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Can't you please just talk to me for one second?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Troy? Is he your husband? Or a boyfriend?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Oh, stop that!  God! Listen, I know you like me.  I can tell. But you know what? A lot of guys like me.  Not me, exactly. It's more like the legs or the butt or the hair.  Or some combination of the above.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: The eyes.  Okay. An eye-man.  Anyhow, it never works out.  Okay?  Not that you even need to know that!  You look like crap, by the way.  What have you been doing?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Cross my heart and hope to die.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Why doesn't it never work out?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Why does it never work out?  You and...men?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: It never works out because I'm into legs and butts and hair myself! That's why! So I wind up with guys who are very good looking, but even more shallow than I am, if you can picture that. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to go find another low-paying, demeaning job where some guy named Jerry keeps telling me how lousy his marriage is.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Why not go to work for me?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Selling all my baseball cards. And helping me buy enough food and supplies to fill several large trucks.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Food and supplies?  Who for?  Like starving people?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Well, they're not starving yet, but they need help.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: How long would you need me?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I've got to make at least a thousand a week.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You got it! Wait here while I change.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Why not buy them milk or something-- instead of Dr. Pepper?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Hey!  Pipe tobacco!  I'm going to need all of this! This is swell!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, another day, another dollar.  Stop staring at me!!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Pick you up at eight tomorrow morning.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Hey, you know. I was thinking...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We'll have to rent a refrigerated truck for the beef and poultry.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: It's your life.  And, by the way, it's a dandy.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I guess we'll need another locker.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: No problem.  We'll just sell another baseball card.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You know, Eve -- don't get mad, okay? - -  but, I'd just be lost without you.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And, um ...I guess... I guess you and I, uh...

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Adam?  Don't even think about it. Okay? I'm sorry.  I know that sounds mean, but believe me, it would be meaner if I didn't say it. Okay?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Now, let's take the truck back and get something to eat.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: There's something else I would like you to help me with.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Well, this is going to sound a little crazy.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: No, no!  I'm sorry!  What is it?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Think of me as your genie.  Just ask.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Well... Okay. I would like you to help me find a...wife.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Because I want to get married.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I don't want to be alone.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You can be single and not alone. Marriage bites!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Everybody knows that. Ask my divorced sisters. Or ask my divorced mom and dad.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It didn't used to be that way.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I wouldn't know.  What kind of wife are you looking for?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And if possible, I'd like to marry someone from Pasadena.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: When do you need her by?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, I could probably get you laid in two weeks, but to locate a non-mutant wife from Pasadena...that could take some time.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That's what I was afraid of.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Could we talk about that a little later?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I told you I've never driven before!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You said it would be easy!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Why, thank you!  Very nice to have met you, Cliff!  May I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: He's a former boyfriend. We lived together for about six months.  And yes, I'll admit it.  I've still kind of got a thing for him.  That's what you wanted to know, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Actually,no. I was wondering why Cliff likes to wear another man's underpants.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Here you go.  One champagne cocktail.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I thought only hookers drank those things.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Well, I know Mom sure likes 'em!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Okay, let's see...I'm not promising anything. You okay?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I'm seeing...snow... lots of snow. Way up North.  Are we getting hot?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You live in...Alaska.  The only way in or out of your place is by plane and... you've definitely come down here for food and supplies and... to find a wife!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Yeah, right!  That's where you'd go to find girls!  Nome.  He's gay, by the way.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: He's gone to check your answers on his computer.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: No.  We keep it in the backyard.  Of course, in the house.  It's in there.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Wazoo!  Try to listen.  Whataya think? Surfer, grunge, hip- hop, Euro trash?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Whatever you two want. If you've got the time, I've got the wazoo.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What about holding your right arm up like that all the time?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It's fine. Just give it a try. And for gosh sake, Eve, take your foot off the chair!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: He's going to kill himself.  Go skate out on the bike path! It's that way!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Have you ever heard the saying, "He hasn't got enough sense to come in out of the rain?"

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yep.  You know, my father -- who is a scientist -- says that everything is a miracle. Everything. Until recently I wasn 't sure what he meant by that.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Yeah? No kidding. Listen, you still want to go girl hunting tonight?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Okay. But you know, this business of finding you a wife -- it's kind of ridiculous, don't you think?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Yes it is. A girlfriend maybe. But a wife? I mean...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Then just help me find a girlfriend! That's all I ask. I'll give you every single card I've got left!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Hey, screw you! Okay? You think I'm just somebody you can buy off! Listen, let me tell you something--

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Would you do it just because you're my friend? My very best friend.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: My goodness gracious!  This place is something!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Quit showing off!  We're here on business!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I thought I was here to meet women.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It's a Rob Roy. A very popular drink, I'm told.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Why?!  I think she's very attractive.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Adam!  She's got bitch written all over her!  You do know what "bitch" means, don't you?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes, I have a dictionary. But I can't understand for the life of me why you would call her that!  Or why Cliff would say that about you.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Because we're bitches!  Look at her! Look at the expression on her face! The walk, the jewelry, the fingernails.  Please!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Yeah, sweet.  That's a nice way of putting it.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What do I say to Miss Sweet when I meet her?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Yes, really! Basically, they want what they think they can't have.  Same with guys.  That's why everybody is walking around here sending off "you can't have me" signals!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Maybe. But that's how it works.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Yeah.  Could be.  Go say hello, Romeo. Looks like a healthy non-mutant to me.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Okay. All right.  And what do I say?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Say something surprising. And funny. Lie, if need be.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Romeo and Juliet. I cried at the end.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You're not from Alaska!  Where'd you learn to dance like that?!  And there are no starving people, are there?!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Why are you suddenly so mad at me?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Don't change the subject! I want you to tell me the truth about yourself.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I've never lied to you.  I've maybe let you believe things that you wanted to believe, but I've never lied.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You think I'm some sort of sap?! Don't you?!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No.  I admire you.  I...I fell in love with you the first time I saw you.  I did. I think that you are the most--

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I want to know exactly who you are and what you're really up to!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: All right. Let me tell you the whole thing. In 1962--

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: And tomorrow maybe Troy will help you out--because I quit!  This is ridiculous! You're ridiculous! I'm ridiculous!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Scare me, why don't you?!!?  You stupid son of a bitch!!!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What in the hell are you doing here!! You're supposed to be over on San Vicente Boulevard having unsafe sex with that slut Sophie!!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, you should be!  Thanks to you, my heart is in my neck!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Eve, if you'll let me, I can --

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Look! I'm limping!  How attractive is that?!  What if this is for life?!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I went to Sophie's and she was very hospitable.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Is that what you call it?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: But it just wasn't where I wanted to be so I left as politely as I could and found a taxi.  But I asked the driver to drop me here instead of at the hotel.  There's a song Mister Como sings called "On the Street Where You Live."  You know it?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: "All at once am I--several stories high-- knowing I'm--on the street-- where you live."  It's about a young man who is overjoyed just to be standing in front of the house of the person he loves.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Adam...dumb question, but humor me. Have you ever had sex before?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I want you to go back to the hotel now.  I'll call you a cab.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Of course.  I shouldn't be over here at this hour.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: That's right.  And I'll see you in the morning in the lobby.  Do you mind waiting outside for the taxi?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Not at all.  And Eve thank you for tonight...and for the kiss. My first.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It was at least as good as the sky.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And I think better than the ocean. I'm serious!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Adam....you should go with Dr. Aron. It's the best thing.  The best thing for you. I promise.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: ...All right, Eve.  If you say so.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Could I please just go home?  I was lost, but this morning I found home and I promise not to bother any of you ever again.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: See! I can't tell them that!  I can't ever let them know. It makes their life..well, frankly... a joke.  I can't let that happen.  You understand?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: We can make this work, Adam! Believe me! I'm very good at making things work!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Is this because of the radiation?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Good evening. I want to stay at this hotel.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Fill this out please. And I'll need a card.

turns.speaker: SODA JERK
turns.text: Yes!  Yes!  Oh, Lord!  Yes, oh, yes! But  where is the one who came last night -- all in yellow?!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: All in yellow?  Oh!  That was my father!

turns.speaker: SODA JERK
turns.text: Ooooohhhh!!  Of course! The father! Forgive me!!  Can you forgive me for my wasted life?!  Everything has been so awful!!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I know it has been terrible.  But it wasn't your fault. And now all the decay is over with and things are going to get better. You understand?

turns.speaker: SODA JERK
turns.text: Of course you do.  I'll stay here and pray.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That's always a good idea! Would you like some money? I have a great deal of it.

turns.speaker: SODA JERK
turns.text: No. I don't need money anymore -- I see that now.

turns.speaker: SODA JERK
turns.text: The front door is open.  Will you be back?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I've got almost everything we need! And this nice man...

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: This is what money looks like.  It comes like this, in coin, or like this in paper.  Or you can have an "investment."  These are stock "certificates" that we bought in your name.  Of course, they're worthless now, but at one time they were quite valuable.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: They're pretty.  Can I have them?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Sure. Now, let's move on to our French exam.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: You're right!  It's Tuesday already! By gosh, time flies, doesn't it?!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: En arte voluptus. Que les bons temps roul√à!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Sorgen sie bitte dafur das die gepack sorgfaltic behandeldt warren!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Haben sie etuas nettes in leder?!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: You know, you have a wonderful sense of humor, son!  I must say, the acorn doesn't fall very far from the tree. By the way, it's time I gave you something. Come with me.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: It's my entire baseball collection. It's yours now.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: It's a game, son. I can explain it pretty easily. There's a pitcher.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Uh, no. There's a man who throws the ball -- to a man who has a bat.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: No, no! The runner on second goes to third! He's out there!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Because he's forced out at third! It's a force!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Your mom made that all by herself.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Holy Cow! What the heck are these?!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Your roller-skates! I redesigned them! I think this new design will work even better!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: These are really swell! I mean swell!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Well, do we just go on up?!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: No, son! We wait for night.  Now...is precisely when... we must be at our... most cautious.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Helen-Thomas-Webber!  Maybe we have been down here a little too long!  Please excuse her French.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: One more thing. If you find a healthy young woman, bring her back with you.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And, I'm asking you to trust me without understanding why.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Well, in that case...of course, son.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: This is great son, just great. By the way, Eve's last name. Rus-to-kov, that's not Russian, is it?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It's Ukrainian. Her grandparents immigrated here.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Dad, I don't know how to tell you this. And I was going to wait a while, but I think...Dad,there was no bomb. A plane crashed into our backyard. I looked it up in old newspapers.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Positive. The Soviet Union collapsed without a shot being fired. The Cold War is over.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: What? Did the politburo just one day say - "We give up?"

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes. That's kind of how it was.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: My gosh, those Commies are brilliant! You've got to hand it to 'em!  "No, we didn't drop any bombs!  Oh yes, our evil empire has collapsed!  Poor, poor us!"  I bet they've even asked the West for aid!  Right?!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Hah!!! Those cagey rascals! Those sly dissemblers! Those, uh...  They've finally pulled the wool over everybody's eyes!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I do? Well, thank you! You like ceilings?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Well, I hope you like these! Fresh sea urchin wrapped in seaweed. Or "nori" if you prefer. I love sushi.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It's a very small place. People don't even know it's there.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Maybe Eve can guess.  She's psychic.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Well, Dionne Warwick, guess his home town.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I've never met anyone like you in my life.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I've got goose-bumps all over me.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Why not just go to... Nome for supplies and a wife?  Isn't that closer?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Well, we try. Listen, let me just ask you a few questions.  When did Alaska become a state?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: When did we get it from them?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: 1867.  Seward's Folly. We paid 7.2 million dollars for it. A tidy sum then, as well as now. I'm quoting my father, of course.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: What are you talking about? This is the new Mac. You a hacker?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: You don't have a computer in your cabin?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: How do you get through those winters?  Well, you're right.  Juneau.  What's the highest peak?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Mt. McKinley.  It's also the highest point in North America.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Okay, maybe she is psychic.  Let's go eat!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That would knock my father out.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Oh, yes.  It would probably kill him.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: He's a Windows guy then, huh?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Well, I think Windows stink. What do you think of that?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: ...I guess it's...just a matter of personal taste.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Why not? He has great pants.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Isn't it a little tiring to sit up straight like that?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I guess a lot of those tall buildings we saw this morning are new.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: The recovery? Oh , yeah! Hey, they rebuilt the freeway in six months.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: That's why little things mean so much to him.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Why did you park way back there?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Miss Rustokov refuses to let total strangers drive her car.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Ladies first, Troy! That was close.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Yes! Lying is always a very effective dating tool.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I'm sorry. I took the Lord's name in vain again, didn't I?  I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No!  There's an Adult Bookstore back there!  I'll be right back!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Okay, Troy!  Let's get those all-beef frozen patties!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: How 'bout we check with Eve first?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: So, did you buy a movie?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: A magazine?  A toy perhaps?  In the bookstore.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No, I wouldn't go in one of those places with a gas mask on.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I know what you mean!  I usually wear a big hat and dark glasses.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And thanks for always being happy!

turns.speaker: BELLBOY
turns.text: You dial nine to get out.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I see.  Well, thank you very much. You've been very, very nice.

turns.speaker: BELLBOY
turns.text: Thank you. Your father is a smart guy.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Good night!  Sleep tight.  Don't let the bedbugs bite!  That's what my Mom always says...  ...who I'm really beginning to miss. I'm sorry.  It's my first night away from home.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I guess living up here makes people look older.

turns.speaker: BELLBOY
turns.text: Up here on the fifteenth floor?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes. Up here on the fifteenth floor. Goodnight.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes, please.  I'm looking for all beef patties.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Come on. Frozen. How much are they?

turns.speaker: BUTCHER
turns.text: Frozen, they're six-thirty a dozen in the three pound box.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Then I'll need, twelve into nine hundred, seventy-five boxes. And that's almost...five hundred dollars just for the hamburger! And my Mom only gave me three thousand dollars for everything! The yacht batteries! The diesel oil! The birthday candles!

turns.speaker: BUTCHER
turns.text: You could have a meat order that big delivered to your home.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Well, that's great then! Terrific...except...it just occurred to me. I don't know where I live! I'm lost! I don't know where home is!  Would you excuse me?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Oh, my holy stars! A Negro!
